Class# MTRCommissioningOperation

iOS 26.2+iPadOS 26.2+Mac Catalyst 26.2+macOS 26.2+tvOS 26.2+visionOS 26.2+watchOS 26.2+

```
class MTRCommissioningOperation
```

## [Topics](/documentation/Matter/MTRCommissioningOperation#topics)

### [Initializers](/documentation/Matter/MTRCommissioningOperation#Initializers)

[`init?(parameters: MTRCommissioningParameters, setupPayload: String, delegate: any MTRCommissioningDelegate, queue: dispatch_queue_t)`](/documentation/matter/mtrcommissioningoperation/init(parameters:setuppayload:delegate:queue:))Prepare to commission a device with the given parameters and the given setup payload (QR code, manual pairing code, etc). Returns nil if the payload is not valid.### [Instance Properties](/documentation/Matter/MTRCommissioningOperation#Instance-Properties)

[`var matchedPayload: MTRSetupPayload?`](/documentation/matter/mtrcommissioningoperation/matchedpayload)If not nil, the payload (from possibly multiple payloads represented by the provided setupPayload) that represents the commissionee we successfully established PASE with. This will only be non-nil after successful PASE establishment.### [Instance Methods](/documentation/Matter/MTRCommissioningOperation#Instance-Methods)

[`func start(with: MTRDeviceController)`](/documentation/matter/mtrcommissioningoperation/start(with:))Start commissioning with the given controller (which identifies the fabric the commissionee should be commissioned into). The delegate will be notified if there are any failures.[`func stop() -> Bool`](/documentation/matter/mtrcommissioningoperation/stop())Stop commissioning. This will typically result in commissioning:failedWithError: callbacks to delegates.## [Relationships](/documentation/Matter/MTRCommissioningOperation#relationships)
